intro: Ficus silvestris, commonly known as the wild fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India, China, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into edible fig fruits. Ficus silvestris thrives in humid environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
